item.title: How to Subclass in Elder Scrolls Online
item.description:
Elder Scrolls Online allows characters of any class to subclass into other skill lines. This system gives characters almost total freedom to learn whatever skills they want, eventually fully unlocking them to use whenever, as if they were skills from their original class.

Unlocking the subclassing system does require players to find a specific NPC and complete their side quest, along with one restriction to even start that quest in the first place. Here's everything you need to know about unlocking subclassing, along with how to use it to permanently unlock any skill line you want, making powerful DPS builds even stronger.

Where to Find Bahtra at-Hunding (A Study in Discipline) in Elder Scrolls Online

You won't be able to start A Study in Discipline and unlock subclassing until one character on your account has reached level 50.

After getting one character to level 50, any character you create on that same account will be able to subclass . First, you'll need to find Bahtra at-Hunding, who appears in three different locations:

  • Riften in The Rift - just to the west of the main waypoint where you can fast-travel to.
  • Dune in Reaper's March - under the bridge next to the waypoint.
  • Evermore in Bangkorai - in the town before the dungeon in the top right of the region.

Talking with her will start the quest to unlock subclassing, and the rest of the quest is fairly straightforward from there. She will first ask you what class you are interested in subclassing into, but this won't make any decisions, as subclassing is actually done in the following menu.

How Does Subclassing Work in Elder Scrolls Online

When talking to Bahtra at-Hunding, you'll be able to choose one skill line from any two classes other than your starting one to start subclassing. This will give you full access to that skill line, and also lock you into it until it reaches level 50. Skills in a subclassed skill line cost 2 skill points to unlock instead of one, and XP earned for that skill line is much slower than your primary class skills.

Once a skill line reaches level 50, it becomes Mastered, and you can forever use it interchangeably with that character just like one of your primary skill lines. You can then also replace that skill line with another to work on mastering more. If you're willing to put the time and effort into it, this system can allow a single character to learn any skill in the game, letting you mix and match anything you can imagine.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: This Iconic ARPG Sequel Is Having a Very Successful Early Access on Steam
item.description:
Titan Quest 2 has sold over 300,000 copies by August 5, 2025, and the Early Access title shows few signs of slowing down. In the wake of its Early Access launch on Steam, Titan Quest 2 has garnered critical and popular acclaim, allowing its strong word-of-mouth to carry it towards success. It is a sequel to the ARPG developed by Iron Lore Entertainment and published by THQ on June 26, 2006. What made the original Titan Quest a success was its dual mastery system, allowing players to combine two classes into unique builds, as well as its gorgeous setting, blending the mythologies of Ancient Greece, Egypt, and China into a hack-and-slash adventure.

Much like its predecessor, Titan Quest 2 takes players to a fictional version of Ancient Greece this time pitting them against the Goddess of Retribution, Nemesis. The game starts players off on Proti Island, which serves as the tutorial zone, before it opens up properly in Pyrgos. While the Early Access for Titan Quest 2 only features one Act, it allows players to progress up to Level 40 with two of four currently available Masteries (Rogue, Warfare, Storm, and Earth).

Titan Quest 2 Has Sold Over 300,000 Copies In Its First 72 Hours

According to THQ Nordic, Titan Quest 2 sold over 300,000 copies within 72 hours of its Early Access launch, surging to the top of the charts on both Steam and the Epic Games Store. The momentum has continued well into its second week, as Titan Quest 2 has maintained 50% of its concurrent player peak despite Early Access only having about 9 to 15 hours of story content. While it may not take long for players to beat Titan Quest 2 , they have nonetheless found it a rather refreshing change from Path of Exile 2 and Diablo 4 .

Unlike Path of Exile 2 and Diablo 4 , which emphasize seasonal content, Grimlore Games is primarily interested in creating a premium single-player experience, with optional co-op. The developers promised that Titan Quest 2 would not have any microtransactions, but would instead be supported by DLCs and expansion packs. While Titan Quest 2 does not have true multiplayer yet, Grimlore Games has promised that it will expand the multiplayer feature throughout Early Access.

The Road Map also promises that proper character creation will come in one of the first major Early Access updates, followed by the introduction of a new Mastery in Titan Quest 2 . While the game won't fully release until late 2026, its success in Early Access bodes well for its future launch, which will also make the game available for Xbox and PlayStation players.

item.title: Grow a Garden: Best Crops Tier List
item.description:
With pets having been added to Roblox 's Grow a Garden , your farmland has gotten a whole new glow-up. Yet, there is a variety of plants you can place there to make it even more beautiful. With every update, the roster keeps growing, and players now have tons of crop options to choose from.

All of them, however, aren't profitable, since some are just temporary plants that vanish after picking, and others regrow but are quite cheap. Thankfully, there are viable options as well, so here's a full tier list explaining all the available crops and which ones are worth investing your Sheckles in.

Updated by Somiya Adrees on August 10, 2025: Grow a Garden now has 143 crops after the 1.18.0 update, including fruits, veggies, flowers, candy, and bone plants. As such, the tier list featured below has been updated to rank all the new ones among the old favorites, allowing players to uncover which ones truly are the best of the best.

Grow a Garden's Best Crops Tier List

The rankings mostly go by how much money a plant makes from its base price . The list also covers every crop added so far, even the ones you cant get anymore. Since lots of players still have them growing, this list can help you figure out if they're worth keeping or tossing.

If you're unsure how to use the tier list, here's a quick breakdown:

  • S-tier crops bring in the most profit.
  • A-tier crops are still solid but dont earn as much as S-tier.
  • B-tier offers a decent Sheckle average.
  • C-tier doesnt pay much, but its a reasonable option for beginners without better crops.
  • D-tier crops arent worth planting at all unless you like how they look or need them for an event.

The Estimated Profit Per Harvest column shows the ideal amount of money you can get from each harvest. For crops that arent multi-harvest, their full profit is listed directly.

All Crops

Tier Ranking

Reasoning

Estimated Profit Per Harvest

Bone Blossom

S Tier

The best plant right now , blessing you with 4 to 6 fruits per harvest cycle (priced at 200k). Its neck-and-neck with Candy Blossom, though that depends on how many fruits your Candy Tree ends up growing.

800,000 Sheckles

Candy Blossom

S Tier

Another top pick. Delivers 8 to 12 Candy Blossom fruits per round, with every one going for over 100k Sheckles.

800,000 Sheckles

Maple Apple

S Tier

About 10 Maple Apples pop out per harvest, each selling for 77k. One of the best crops to have around, since this tree often produces more than 10 fruits.

770,000 Sheckles

Spiked Mango

S Tier

Makes eight thorny spiked mangoes, each with a good base value of 67,500 Sheckles.

540,000 Sheckles

Dragon Pepper

S Tier

Reharvestable fruit that yields 6 fruits per round, each priced at 88k Sheckles.

528,000 Sheckles

Fossilight

S Tier

Keeps up with Dragon Pepper in how many fruits it makes, but can't top its value and total earnings (88k each).

528,000 Sheckles

Elephant Ears

S Tier

Yields 6 fruits per harvest, each selling for 77k.

462,000 Sheckles

Giant Pinecone

S Tier

More profitable than Fossilight Fruit and Dragon Pepper, it yields 6 fruits worth 72k each.

432,000 Sheckles

Sugar Apple

S Tier

Better than Moon Blossom, Hive Fruit, and Beanstalk, but not as valuable as Dragon Pepper and Elephant Ears. Grows 8 apples at once, each selling for 48k Sheckles.

384,000 Sheckles

Tranquil Bloom

S Tier

One of the few plants with a high selling value, four blooms at 93k a pop.

372,000 Sheckles

Traveler's Fruit

S Tier

This crop from the Mega Harvest update yields 5 fruits per harvest, with each fruit selling for 70k.

350,000 Sheckles

Moon Blossom

S Tier

Grants 5 flowers, and each one sells for 66k.

330,000 Sheckles

Hive Fruit

S Tier

It provides 5 fruits at once, each worth around 62k Sheckles.

310,000 Sheckles

Beanstalk

S Tier

Beanstalk keeps growing back after each cycle, letting you collect up to 11 at a time, each selling for 28k.

308,000 Sheckles

Bitter Melon

S Tier

The best plant from the Connoisseur Event (1.18.0 update), it nourishes into four melons that sell for 77k each.

308,000 Sheckles

Moon Mango

S Tier

Second best to Bone Blossom and Candy Blossom, its a multi-harvest crop that spawns 6 to 17 mangoes at a time, each valued at 50k Sheckles.

300,000 Sheckles

Elder Strawberry

S Tier

Not your average berry bush, pulls in 3 to 4 strawberries per round, and they're 90k a pop.

270,000 Sheckles

Grand Tomato

S Tier

Like Elder Strawberry gives around 3 to 4 tomatoes, each going for about 88k.

268,000 Sheckles

Lily of the Valley

A Tier

With 5 flowers popping up per harvest, Lily of the Valley can cash in big, with each bloom selling for up to 49k.

245,600 Sheckles

Lilac

A Tier

Close to Beanstalk in profit; it grows 7 flowers, with each selling for 35k Sheckles.

245,000 Sheckles

Nectarine

A Tier

Grants 5 fruits at once, with each selling for nearly 48k Sheckles.

240,000 Sheckles

Serenity

A Tier

Around seven flowers bloom on the plant, and one of them is priced at 30k.

210,000 Sheckles

Guanabana

A Tier

The Guanabana crop spawns a minimum of 3 fruits, with each one selling for 70k.

210,320 Sheckles

Grand Volcania

A Tier

Produces 3 flowers at once, and each one sells for 70k Sheckles.

210,000 Sheckles

Rosy Delight

A Tier

A multi-harvest crop that gives 3 roses, each valued at 69k.

207,000 Sheckles

Parasol Flower

A Tier

Offers good value despite being a single-harvest plant.

200,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Badlands Pepper

A Tier

Food-type plant that produces four peppers, each with an average selling value of 45k.

180,000 Sheckles

Nectar Thorn

A Tier

Better to cultivate than any of the A-tier flower plants, since its a permanent crop and produces 4 flowers per harvest, with each being worth 44k Sheckles.

176,000 Sheckles

Amber Spine

A Tier

More profitable than Sunflower; it blesses 3 spines, selling for 55k each.

165,000 Sheckles

Sunflower

A Tier

Reproduces many sunflowers worth 160k, but only 1 grows at a time (better than Mushroom or Bendboo).

160,000 Sheckles

Bendboo

A Tier

An upgraded Bamboo variant with a whopping 155k Sheckle value.

155,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Mushroom

A Tier

One-time plant but sells for 151k. Its mutation is wild for profit.

151,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Zen Rocks

A Tier

A one-use plant from the Zen update that doesnt top the past update's Parasol Flower in selling price.

150,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Firefly Fern

A Tier

Offers stronger returns than Burning Bud after its nerf (two ferns per round at 72k base value).

144,000 Sheckles

Boneboo

A Tier

Just a one-shot plant; beats Bamboo but doesnt top Bendboo.

141,141 Sheckles (One-time)

Burning Bud

A Tier

A Prismatic seed from the Prehistoric update, it regrows and gives 2 buds at a time with a 70k base value.

140,000 Sheckles

Lingonberry

A Tier

Youll get 4 berries from it, each worth 35k. It's pretty close to Burning Bud in terms of profit.

140,000 Sheckles

Soft Sunshine

A Tier

Leafy flower-type plant that regrows up to three flowers, one for 45k Sheckles.

135,000 Sheckles

Cocovine

A Tier

Similar to Dragon Pepper, but it drops 2 to 6 fruits at a time, with each being worth 66k Sheckles.

132,000 Sheckles

Lucky Bamboo

A Tier

The first bamboo-like plant that gives two Bamboos at 65k each.

130,000 Sheckles

Enkaku

A Tier

You can harvest 2 to 3 Enkakus in one round, with the average value of one at 62k.

124,000 Sheckles

Taro Flower

A Tier

Grants just one flower worth over 120k, then disappears from the garden completely.

120,000 Sheckles (One-time)

King Cabbage

A Tier

A more viable option than Taro Flower, as it produces one veggie after each pick, unlike pure one-time fruits.

120,000 Sheckles

Butternut Squash

A Tier

A food-type crop from the 1.18.0 update that grows about 3 to 4 squashes, each selling for around 45k according to the in-game market value.

105,000 Sheckles

Tall Asparagus

A Tier

Multi-Harvest plant but gives you 1 Asparagus in one harvest cycle.

100,000 Sheckles

Crown Melon

A Tier

Currently priced at 50k, it drops 2 melons.

100,000 Sheckles

Honeysuckle

A Tier

Just like Lumira but with a better selling value: 100k Sheckles.

100,000 Sheckles

Sakura Bush

B Tier

Yields 3 to 6 flowers per harvest, each going for 28,500 Sheckles

85,500 Sheckles

Lumira

B Tier

Although reharvestable, it grows only 1 plant each round, worth 85k Sheckles. With the sprinkler glitch and the right mutations, it can make you billions.

85,000 Sheckles

Venus Fly Trap

B Tier

Makes a lot, and each trap is worth 85k.

85,000 Sheckles

Mango

B Tier

Gives a bunch of fruit just like in real life (approximately 13), and each is worth 6,500.

84,500 Sheckles

Pricklefruit

B Tier

In the range of 80,000 shekels per fruit. Its reharvestable.

80,000 Sheckles

Hinomai

B Tier

A Chinese-themed botanical plant that yields one Hinomai per harvest cycle, selling for 80k.

80,000 Sheckles

Candy Sunflower

B Tier

Single harvest but brings in 80k each.

80,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Celestiberry

B Tier

Better than Grape and Pepper in both selling value and multi-harvest ability, offering more berries (approximately 8).

80,000 Sheckles

Suncoil

B Tier

Falls between Lumira and Honeysuckle in value, sitting at 80k Sheckles.

80,000 Sheckles

Feijoa

B Tier

6 Feijoa comes in one batch, with each tagged at 13k.

78,000 Sheckles

Purple Dahlia

B Tier

Multi-harvest flower that produces 1 Dahlia at a time, with each selling for around 75k Sheckles.

75,000 Sheckles

Taco Fern

B Tier

It has a 75k base value, but only produces one Fern at a time.

75,000 Sheckles

Twisted Tangle

B Tier

Not the friendliest to touch (a thorny plant), but drops 3 to 4 Tangles with ease.

75,000 Sheckles

Moon Melon

B Tier

Multi-harvest plant that grants 4 melons that trade for 18k Sheckles each.

72,000 Sheckles

Sugarglaze

B Tier

A donut-shaped plant from the cooking event thats pretty decent.

70,000 Sheckles

Aloe Vera

B Tier

Its a single-harvest plant that gives a one-shot pay-out of 69k Sheckles.

69,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Horned Dinoshroom

B Tier

Like Aloe Vera in price and fruit count, but it regrows after every cycle, so better than that in this range.

69,000 Sheckles

Ember Lily

B Tier

Regrows 1 at a time for 66k Sheckles. Not as good as Honeysuckle, Suncoil, or Lumira.

66,000 Sheckles

Pink Lily

B Tier

Reproduces but only yields 1 flower at a time. Worth around 65k Sheckles.

65,000 Sheckles

Prickly Pear

B Tier

This plant resembles a cactus and yields 9 red prickly pears. All are tagged at 7k.

63,000 Sheckles

Starfruit

B Tier

Multi-harvest crop that spawns 4 starfruits, with each going for around 15k.

60,000 Sheckles

Jalapeno

B Tier

A cooking ingredient plant that whips up 2 jalapenos (30k each).

60,000 Sheckles

Pitcher Plant

B Tier

While it offers a similar profit to Pepper, this crop only produces 1 Pitcher Plant per round.

52,000 Sheckles

Paradise Petal

B Tier

2 petals spawn on the tree with a 25k general price. Also, it's a multi-harvest plant.

50,000 Sheckles

Violet Corn

B Tier

Outperforms other multi-harvest flowers like Foxglove and Succulent, with a top value of 50k.

50,000 Sheckles

Dandelion

B Tier

Like with Nectarshade, plant in bulk and wait for mutations if you want massive returns.

50,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Red Lollipop

B Tier

One-time lollipop that sells for 50k Sheckles.

50,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Rose

B Tier

A nice pick, since it grows back in bunches and sells for a hefty price when you stack the variants.

50,000 Sheckles

Nectarshade

B Tier

Should be planted in batches of at least 30 to 50 and must gain mutations like Celestial, Voidtouched, and Shocked.

48,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Cacao

B Tier

This divine crop can be harvested multiple times (up to 4), with each bringing in 12k money.

48,000 Sheckles

Loquat

B Tier

Comparable to Cacao in terms of profit, though it yields 6 loquats, each for 8k.

48,000 Sheckles

Pear

B Tier

One is priced at 20k Sheckles, and the plant produces 2 pears.

40,000 Sheckles

Grape

B Tier

A multi-harvest berry plant that produces 5 grapes, with each selling for 7,850.

39,250 Sheckles

Eggplant

B Tier

Gets you 3 eggplants with a selling value of 12k.

36,000 Sheckles

Lotus

B Tier

Same deal as Cursed Fruit in price and type.

35,000 Sheckles

Stonebite

B Tier

Similar to Lotus in profit, though its a single-use plant.

35,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Cantaloupe

B Tier

Only 1 cantaloupe spawns at a time, but the price is fairly reasonable at 34k.

34,000 Sheckles

Pepper

B Tier

Reharvestable veggie that grows 4 peppers at a time, with each being worth 8k.

32,000 Sheckles

Spring Onion

B Tier

A one-time plant from the Connoisseur Event thats valued similarly to Artichoke and Crocus from past updates.

30,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Artichoke

B Tier

One of the craftable single-harvest plants from the Cooking event.

30,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Crocus

B Tier

Sells for around 30k Sheckles, but it cant reproduce. It's best used for pairing mutations.

30,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Horsetail

B Tier

Matches Crocus in value and harvest type.

30,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Rhubarb

B Tier

An uncommon crop that produces a pair of rhubarbs, each selling for 15k at the Shell Shop.

30,000 Sheckles

Dezen

B Tier

Looks gorgeous glowing in your plot, but its a one-and-done kind of plant.

29,250 Sheckles (One-time)

Moonflower

B Tier

You get 3 to 4 flowers, and each sells for 9.5k.

28,500 Sheckles

Veinpetal

B Tier

Blood-red plant with octopus-like petals, but only pops out one per round.

25,000 Sheckles

Cursed Fruit

B Tier

Same, multi-harvest, and goes for 25k.

25,000 Sheckles

Moonglow

B Tier

Keeps producing 1 Moonglow, which then goes for 25k.

25,000 Sheckles

Manuka Flower

B Tier

Takes a lot of effort to craft, and its a single-harvest plant that sells for around 25k on average. Its a profitable crop only if youre stacking lots of variants.

25,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Lavender

B Tier

Very similar to the Manuka Flower in both price and type. It only makes sense to grow if youre aiming to combine multiple mutations on it.

25,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Wild Carrot

B Tier

Another single-use plant that trades for 25k.

25,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Succulent

B Tier

Kind of like Foxglove, its a multi-harvest plant that only gives 1 flower per round, but it makes up for it with a better price, averaging at 25k.

25,000 Sheckles

Zenflare

B Tier

Like Monoblooma in price, but better since it regrows after being picked

25,000 Sheckles

Blood Banana

B Tier

A solid pick. It regrows with 4 bananas, and each one sells for 6k Sheckles.

24,000 Sheckles

Delphinium

B Tier

It offers the same 24k Sheckles profit as Blood Banana but isnt better, since its not multi-harvest.

24,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Peace Lily

B Tier

Just like Delphinium in both profit and harvestability.

24,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Durian

B Tier

You get 3 fruits from it, and each goes for 7.5k.

22,500 Sheckles

Monoblooma

B Tier

Its not a crop that produces multiple fruits, but it easily sells for 22k once picked.

22,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Foxglove

B Tier

Cultivates 1 per cycle, with a selling value of 20k Sheckles.

20,000 Sheckles

Kiwi

C Tier

Even with 7 fruits, it doesnt outperform Cacao, Pepper, or most B-tier plants.

19,250 Sheckles

Bee Balm

C Tier

Spawns 3 flowers per round, with each being priced at 18k Sheckles. Can regrow.

18,000 Sheckles

Bell Pepper

C Tier

3 bell peppers grow from one leafy plant, with each being valued at 5.5k.

16,500 Sheckles

Soul Fruit

C Tier

Pretty much like Passionfruit in how it works and sells (7,750 each).

15,500 Sheckles

Dragon Fruit

C Tier

Grows 2 to 3 at once, with each being worth 4,750.

14,250 Sheckles

Cranberry

C Tier

Players can pick 4 berries in each round, with each being worth 3.5k.

13,600 Sheckles

Coconut

C Tier

Gives 32 pieces. 1 usually goes for 400 Sheckles, but with the right mutations, it can reach millions.

12,800 Sheckles

Chocolate Carrot

C Tier

Doesn't reproduce and is still worth 11k.

11,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Passionfruit

C Tier

Grows about 3 fruits per round, with each selling for 3,550 Sheckles.

10,650 Sheckles

Cactus

C Tier

Makes 3 cacti in one cycle that sell for 3.4k Sheckles each.

10,200 Sheckles

Onion

C Tier

An uncommon plant from the Gourmet Seed Pack that disappears after one harvest.

10,000 Sheckles (One-time)

C Tier

Only worth it in mutated form. 4 eggs sold at 2.5k Sheckles per egg.

10,000 Sheckles

Banana

C Tier

Spawns 4 bananas, with each being priced at 1,750 Sheckles.

7,000 Sheckles

Mint

C Tier

Worth it when you sell the mutated versions.

5,250 Sheckles

Bamboo

C Tier

Its a one-time crop, but the mutated versions can earn you a lot.

4,000 Sheckles

Rafflesia

C Tier

Its a one-time plant that sells for 3,500 max.

3,500 Sheckles (One-time)

Nightshade

C Tier

Just average and only usable once.

3,500 Sheckles (One-time)

Cherry Blossom

C Tier

Low value unless mutated.

3,500 Sheckles

Pumpkin

C Tier

Not reharvestable but okay value. Better with mutations.

3,400 Sheckles

Watermelon

C Tier

Only makes sense to sell when mutated.

3,000 Sheckles

Glowshroom

C Tier

Each goes for 300 Sheckles, and each plant yields 10 in total.

3,000 Sheckles

Papaya

C Tier

Produces a lot, with each going for 1,000 Sheckles.

3,000 Sheckles

Apple

C Tier

Low cost, but it's not bad early on since it gives you 10 apples in a single harvest.

2,750 Sheckles

Lemon

C Tier

Pretty much the same deal as Cherry Blossom.

2,450 Sheckles

Avocado

C Tier

From one tree, you get 6 avocados, with each fruit going for 350 Sheckles.

2,100 Sheckles

Pineapple

C Tier

Grows back again, and each sells for 2,000 Sheckles.

2,000 Sheckles

Green Apple

C Tier

A reharvestable tree that spawns 6 greenish apples. Despite their higher price of 300 Sheckles, they still fall short compared to regular apples.

1,800 Sheckles

Peach

C Tier

Works fine if you're planning to sell the mutated version.

1,800 Sheckles

Daffodil

C Tier

Same as Orange Tulip.

1,000 Sheckles (One-time)

Raspberry

D Tier

One tile gives 9 raspberries, but each is only priced at 300.

900 Sheckles

Orange Tulip

D Tier

A one-time crop that doesn't bring much value.

850 Sheckles (One-time)

Blueberry

D Tier

Regrows with 7 berries but makes very little money.

140 Sheckles

Tomato

D Tier

Tomato trees can produce 4 fruits in one go.

120 Sheckles

Strawberry

D Tier

Only worth planting if youve got nothing better.

60 Sheckles

Cauliflower

D Tier

Pretty useless unless you're low on cash or theres an event asking for it.

50 Sheckles

Corn

D Tier

Super low value.

40 Sheckles

Carrot

D Tier

Not reharvestable and sells cheap.

20 Sheckles (One-time)

The profit you get from each plant can also depend on the size and weight of its fruits . Some crops may be better than others if they consistently grow heavier-than-average fruits. For example, Moon Mango has a lower base profit than Maple Apple but often grows big fruits, meaning it can end up earning more than its listed value.

Best Plants for Stacking Mutations in Grow a Garden

While the list above ranks crops by overall value, some GaG plants may have lower total profitability, but higher base value per fruit, making them ideal for stacking mutations. By combining mutations from weather effects, pets, and tools, you can turn their worth into the trillions. Special fruits like Bone Blossom and Honeysuckle can also become massive using the Sprinkler method, which further increases their selling price.

Best Plants for Stacking Mutations

Base Price

Avg Fruit Count

Bone Blossom

200,000 Sheckles

4 to 6

Parasol Flower

200,000 Sheckles

1

Sunflower

160,000 Sheckles

1

Candy Blossom

100,000 Sheckles

8 to 12

Honeysuckle

100,000 Sheckles

1

Best Seeds in Grow a Garden

Heres a quick look at the must-have plants in Grow a Garden :

  • After the 1.13.0 update, weve finally got a seed thats changed the meta. Bone Blossom is now the best seed in Grow a Garden , but its limited to giving 4 to 6 blossoms, while Candy Blossom can give up to 12. So, the ranking also depends on the player's luck.
  • No doubt, Candy Blossom is one of the best plants in Grow a Garden . Its selling value is ridiculous, especially when stacked with mutations. It can literally go for billions.
  • Instead of Beanstalk, Sugar Apple has taken the top spot among seed shop plants, with each unit selling for 48k Sheckles (yields eight at a time). It's the best non-event plant out there and gives premium crops some serious competition.
  • Spiked Mango and Maple Apple are now part of the current meta thanks to their high profits. While its a bit lower in tier, Moon Mango still holds up as one of the best plants. You usually get a big tree that can produce up to 17 fruits in one go. Otherwise, replanting it with the Reclaimer is always a sweet option. It also tends to give big fruits, which can add up significantly, especially if you're using the Sprinkler Method.

item.title: Pokemon GO Players to Receive Compensation for Raid Day Bug
item.description:
Niantic has confirmed that Pokemon GO players will be receiving compensation for a major bug that impacted the recent Ultra Unlock Raid Day, affecting specific spawn rates for the main Pokemon. The mobile monster-catching game from Niantic has seen lots of big events throughout the summer, bringing a variety of new Pokemon to the game. Pokemon GO has brought everything from Hisuian Zorua and Zoroark to the Snom and Honedge evolutions lines to the game, culminating in the game's Pokemon GO Fest: "Max Finale" coming later this month. However, one particular event did not go quite as planned for Niantic.

This year's Pokemon GO Fest brought a variety of incentives to players as part of its "Ultra Unlock" campaign. The event encouraged players to complete a variety of Global Challenges to unlock more rewards, with more challenges offering different rewards. Players quickly smashed through each tier of the challenge to reach the max rewards, unlocking the Hisui Celebration, Steel and Scales, and a Raid Day for Origin Forme Dialga and Palkia. Now, Niantic is confirming that the Raid Day was the victim of a significant bug.

A post shared by Niantic's official support Twitter shares more details about the issues with Origin Raid Day. The post confirms that there was indeed an in-game bug with the "appearance rates of shiny Origin Forme Dialga and Palkia" within the event. Niantic reveals that it intends to compensate players for the issue at a later date, not directly confirming any form of rewards players will receive as a result of the bug. The event was originally supposed to feature higher spawn rates for the shiny variants of the two featured Legendary Pokemon.

Pokemon GO Compensating Players for Origin Raid Bug

The bug with Pokemon GO 's newest Raid Day heavily impacts what was set to be one of the biggest parts of the Pokemon GO Fest celebration. Pokemon GO will host its previously-mentioned "Max Finale" later this month, welcoming the arrival of Eternatus to the mobile game. The introduction of Eternatus will come with the newest Max Battle being added to the game, with players tasked with squaring off against the imposing Eternamax form of Eternatus. Pokemon GO 's Max Finale is set to kick off on August 18, running through August 23.

Beyond the grand finale of Pokemon GO Fest, Niantic looks to have plenty in store for fans of the mobile game. Niantic has already confirmed Flabebe as the featured Pokemon for September's Community Day, featuring different forms and colorations of Flabebe in different regions. Pokemon GO has even revealed the dates for the two following Community Days, getting players excited for both the October and November events. Niantic and Pokemon GO are primed to keep the fun rolling, with lots coming after Pokemon GO Fest concludes.

,

item.title: Maelle One-Shot (Nuke) Build in Clair Obscur Expedition 33
item.description:
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has all sorts of builds for players to try, with it being really easy to respec and switch things around as often as you'd like. While every character in the party has their uses and can excel in dealing damage, there are some characters who do it just a little bit better than their peers.

Maelle is already one of the strongest characters you can use, but she has a very specific single-purpose build, which can lead to her dealing hundreds of thousands, if not millions, of damage to an enemy. This build was nerfed shortly after its discovery, but even with the nerf, it is one of the strongest ways to build Maelle.

Pictos & Luminas for Maelle Nuke Build in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

The focus on this build is having Maelle go first in battle, landing a massive attack right away. The exact combination of Pictos and Lumina of everything that follows is up to you, as long as she has the buffs.

Picto/Lumina

Effect

First Strike

Go first in combat.

Energizing Start 1,2,3,4

The skill for this build requires eight action points, so she'll need all of these to use the attack on the first turn.

First Offensive

First hit dealt and taken deals 50% more damage.

Full Strength

35% increased damage on full health.

Immaculate

30% increased damage until a hit is received.

Painted Power

Damage can exceed 9,999.

Teamwork

10% increased damage while all allies are alive.

Confident Fighter

30% increased damage, but can't be healed.

Augmented First Strike

50% increased damage on first hit.

A lot of these bonuses can be a double-edged sword, but as long as you kill or almost kill your enemy on the first hit, you won't need to worry about the negative effects.

Weapon, Stats, & Skill for the Maelle Nuke Build in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

The Medalum weapon in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is very important for this build, as it has Maelle enter Virtouse stance right at the start of battle , giving her an additional 200% boost in damage. With this weapon, you'll want to invest all your attributes into the following stats, maxing them out in this order:

  • Defense
  • Agility
  • Might

Medalum scales off Defense and Agility, making those attributes the more important ones.


Finally, the centerpiece for the build is the skill Stendhal , which deals extreme void damage in one hit, though it removes self-shields and applies Defenceless to Maelle. The goal of every battle is to hit the enemy with this skill on the first turn, taking advantage of all the bonuses from your Pictos, multiplying the base damage from your weapon, and base attributes. It may not one-shot bosses right after beating the game, but getting close to max level will see this build one-shotting just about anything in the game.

10 Images
10 Images
